channel.title: js on SoByte
channel.description: Recent content in js on SoByte

item.title: The Webb space telescope that captured the universe, with its flight software written in C++ and a built-in custom JS interpreter
item.description: NASA yesterday released the first full set of full-color images of the deep space from the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST). According to the report, JWST is estimated to cost up to $10 billion in total. It was lifted off by an Ariane 5 rocket on Dec. 25 last year. Once in space, JWST will need to travel for a period of time before entering its intended orbit, and will remain in orbit thereafter.

item.title: Clipboard Operations Clipboard Api Tutorial
item.description: 1, Introduction Browsers allow JavaScript scripts to read and write to the clipboard to automatically copy or paste content. In general, scripts should not alter the user’s clipboard in a way that does not meet the user’s expectations. However, there are times when this is convenient, such as the “one-click copy” feature, where the user clicks a button and the specified content automatically goes to the clipboard. Currently, there are three ways to implement clipboard operations.
